qas.question: What American is considered to have been a seminal influence in the charismatic movement?
When was the Massey conference held?
The Massey conference eventually led to developing what seminars?
Name UK influences on the Charismatic movement.

answers.text: Colin Urquhart, Michael Harper, David Watson

qas.question: Where was the Massey conference held?

context: In America, Episcopalian <a0_0>Dennis Bennett<a0_0/> is sometimes cited as one of the charismatic movement's seminal influence. In the United Kingdom, <a3_0>Colin Urquhart, Michael Harper, David Watson<a3_0/> and others were in the vanguard of similar developments. The Massey conference in <a4_0>New Zealand<a4_0/>, <a1_0>1964<a1_0/> was attended by several Anglicans, including the Rev. Ray Muller, who went on to invite Bennett to New Zealand in 1966, and played a leading role in developing and promoting the <a2_0>Life in the Spirit<a2_0/> seminars. Other Charismatic movement leaders in New Zealand include Bill Subritzky.
